korelaerernePage.title: Meet Our Driving Instructors
korelaerernePage.subtitle: Professional and Dedicated Instructors
korelaerernePage.description: Our team of experienced driving instructors is here to guide you every step of the way on your journey to getting your driver's license. We provide personalized instruction to ensure you feel confident and well-prepared for both the theory and practical driving tests.

contactPage.title: Contact us
contactPage.contactPrompt: We’re ready to help if you have questions about our courses, pricing or process.
contactPage.ambitionMessage: Call or email us – we’ll get back to you quickly.

infoPage.title: Information
infoPage.description: Welcome to Junkers Driving School. Here you will find all the important information about us – our team, how to contact us, and tools that support you in your journey.

littleHelper.vehicle_dimensions.text: With or without load, a vehicle may be no wider than 2.55 meters, no higher than 4 meters (measured from the road surface), and no longer than 12 meters. Vehicle combinations (car + trailer) may be up to 18.75 meters. Cargo must be marked if it extends more than 1 meter beyond the front or rear or more than 15 cm beyond the sides.
littleHelper.alcohol.note: You may still be punished even with a blood alcohol level below 0.5‰!
littleHelper.warning_triangle.text: In case of breakdown or engine failure where the car poses a danger or obstruction, a warning triangle must be placed immediately. On ordinary roads, place it at least 50 meters before the car, and on motorways at least 100 meters before.
littleHelper.towing.text: You are allowed to tow another car. The distance between vehicles may not exceed 4 meters. If the distance is more than 2 meters, the rope must be clearly marked. Speed must not exceed 30 km/h. Special rules apply on motorways.
littleHelper.road_risks.list.1: Surroundings: buildings, forest, open fields, beach, etc.
littleHelper.road_risks.list.2: Features: road width, surface, lighting, bike lanes, signals
littleHelper.road_risks.list.3: Layout: hills, rail crossings, turns, intersections, roundabouts
littleHelper.road_risks.list.4: Usage: schools, stations, shopping areas, traffic volume
littleHelper.police_signals.intro: Police can manually control traffic, and their signals function like traffic lights. Drivers must recognize and respond correctly. Below are the four main signals:
littleHelper.police_signals.1: Stop (1): Police stands sideways with arms extended. Traffic from front and back must stop.
littleHelper.police_signals.2: Stop (2): Police faces you (or turns back) without raised arms – you must stop.
littleHelper.police_signals.3: Ready: One arm raised vertically – signal is about to change. Be ready.
littleHelper.police_signals.4: Go: Police stands sideways with one arm extended – side traffic may proceed.
littleHelper.police_signals.reminder: Note: Police signals override both traffic lights and signs.
littleHelper.yield.unconditional: Give way to all traffic from both left and right. E.g. when exiting parking lots, private property, gas stations, minor roads, or roads crossing sidewalks or bike paths.
littleHelper.yield.right: Give way to traffic from the right. Check if traffic from the left can and will yield. Applies when no signs indicate otherwise.
littleHelper.stopping_parking.stopping: Any halt of the vehicle for up to 3 minutes. Not counting traffic stops or maneuvers.
littleHelper.stopping_parking.parking: Any halt of the vehicle for at least 3 minutes. Excludes loading/unloading or picking up/dropping off passengers.
littleHelper.stopping_parking.no_stop: E.g. on footpaths, bike lanes, hatched areas, sidewalks, near intersections, solid lines, pedestrian crossings, hilltops, turns, underpasses, and where yellow kerb markings are present.
littleHelper.stopping_parking.no_parking: E.g. in front of driveways, too close to rail crossings, on main roads, where yellow dashed lines are painted, in taxi zones, or in front of traffic signs.
littleHelper.lane_merge.text: If a lane ends, you must merge – even if indicated by signage. Pay attention to vehicles behind you, lane markings, and road layout.
littleHelper.overtaking.1: Overtake on the left under normal circumstances
littleHelper.overtaking.2: May overtake on the right if the vehicle in front is turning left and it's safe
littleHelper.overtaking.3: Overtaking is forbidden in intersections unless: multiple lanes, turning vehicle, regulated by lights or police, or oncoming traffic must yield
littleHelper.overtaking.4: Forbidden before and on railway crossings, in hills and curves with poor visibility
littleHelper.overtaking.5: Exception: Two-wheeled bicycles and mopeds may be overtaken in intersections, hills, and curves
littleHelper.driving_dark.1: Dim your lights 200–300 m before oncoming car/motorcycle
littleHelper.driving_dark.2: Dim your lights 100–150 m before cyclist or pedestrian
littleHelper.driving_dark.3: Reduce speed before dimming. On narrow roads: max 40 km/h when meeting oncoming traffic.

ribe.subtitle: Get your driver's license with us in Ribe – safe and effective
ribe.title: Our Ribe Location
ribe.desc: At our Ribe location, you’ll get a safe and comfortable start to your driving journey. We provide thorough and dedicated instruction with a strong focus on your personal development and confidence in traffic. With calm surroundings and experienced instructors, Ribe is the ideal place to earn your license – whether you're a first-time driver or renewing your license.

billund.subtitle: Start your journey towards your license in Billund
billund.title: Our Billund Location
billund.desc: Our Billund department is modern, flexible, and tailored to your needs. You’ll be taught by skilled and passionate instructors who guide you safely through every step of the process. The location is central and easy to reach, and we create a relaxed and welcoming atmosphere where you’ll feel comfortable from day one.

grindsted.subtitle: Professional driving instruction in Grindsted
grindsted.title: Our Grindsted Location
grindsted.desc: IIn Grindsted, you’ll meet a friendly and experienced team passionate about helping you become a safe and confident driver. We teach with a personal approach and adapt to your learning style. Whether you're taking your first license or renewing it, we’ll make sure you’re well-prepared for both the theory and practical driving.

bil-korekort.title: Car Driving License
bil-korekort.subtitle: (Category B)
bil-korekort.hero: Get your car license with us – safe, fast and effective.
bil-korekort.cta: Ready to get your car driving license?
bil-korekort.body:
We offer training with modern cars and experienced instructors. You'll receive both theory and practical lessons in a safe environment.
Start your journey towards getting your license today!

trailer-korekort.title: Trailer Driving License
trailer-korekort.subtitle: (Category BE)
trailer-korekort.hero: Gain the right to tow larger trailers – we guide you all the way.
trailer-korekort.cta: Do you need a trailer license for work or leisure?
trailer-korekort.body:
Our trailer courses give you the knowledge and skills needed to tow safely.
Theory, practice, and exam – we’ll guide you through it all.

traktor-korekort.title: Tractor Driving License
traktor-korekort.subtitle: (Category T)
traktor-korekort.hero: Get your tractor license quickly and easily with us.
traktor-korekort.cta: Need a tractor license for agriculture or work?
traktor-korekort.body:
Our tractor courses offer professional training and hands-on experience.
Ideal for young people and adults working in agriculture.

generhvervelse-korekort.title: License Reinstatement
generhvervelse-korekort.subtitle: (Category B)
generhvervelse-korekort.hero: We’ll help you reclaim your license.
generhvervelse-korekort.cta: Need to reacquire your license after revocation?
generhvervelse-korekort.body:
We offer targeted programs for those reacquiring their license.
Personal guidance and instruction to help you pass again.

section1.title: 1. Collection and Processing of Personal Data
section1.description: When you contact us via the contact form on the Junkers Køreskole website, we collect and process the following data on behalf of Mjunker ApS (CVR 35382674):

list.name: Name
list.details: Any details you provide in your message

section1.note: This information is used solely to respond to your inquiry and follow up if necessary.

section2.title: 2. Storage and Deletion of Data
section2.description: Your data is stored securely and confidentially and will be automatically deleted after 30 days.
section2.info: If your inquiry concerns registration for a driving course, please contact Go’n Drive directly. Registration data is submitted through their platform and is handled solely by Go’n Drive as the data controller.
section2.note: If you wish to have your data deleted earlier, please contact our technical data processor Arzonic ApS (CVR 45630102) and provide your name and email address so we can locate your information in the system. Write to:

section3.title: 3. Disclosure and Technical Access
section3.description: Your information is not shared with third parties unless necessary to process your inquiry. The Junkers Køreskole website and database are technically operated by Arzonic ApS (CVR 45630102), acting as a data processor with access to the data on behalf of Mjunker ApS. A data processing agreement has been entered into in accordance with applicable GDPR regulations.

section4.title: 4. Your Rights
section4.description: You have the right at any time to:

list.access: Access the data we have about you
list.correct: Have incorrect or outdated information corrected
list.delete: Request deletion of your data (before automatic deletion)

section4.note: To exercise your rights, please contact us at

section5.title: 5. Consent
section5.description1: By submitting a message via the contact form, you consent to Mjunker ApS processing your data as described above.
section5.description2: Registration for driving courses takes place exclusively through Go n' Drive, which is an independent data controller. By registering, you are therefore subject to Go n' Drive’s own consent and privacy policy.

section6.title: 6. Data Security
section6.description: Appropriate technical and organizational measures are in place to protect your data against unauthorized access, misuse, or disclosure. Arzonic ApS is responsible for the operation and security of the web platform.

section7.title: 7. Changes to This Policy
section7.description: We reserve the right to update this consent and privacy policy. The latest version will always be available on our website.

TermsModal.title: Terms and Conditions
TermsModal.effectiveNote: These terms apply to the use of the website and contact form at junkerskøreskole.dk.

section1.title: 1. Introduction
section1.description: These terms apply to visitors and users of the website junkerskøreskole.dk, which is operated by Mjunker ApS (CVR 35382674). By using the website, you accept these terms.

section2.title: 2. Course Registration
section2.description: Registration for driving courses takes place via Go’n Drive, which is independently responsible for administration, payment, and instruction. Mjunker ApS only refers users to Go’n Drive’s system and privacy policy.

section3.title: 3. Use of Contact Form
section3.description: By using the contact form, you consent to Mjunker ApS contacting you in response to your inquiry. All submitted data is automatically deleted after 30 days.

section4.title: 4. Technical Operation
section4.description: The website is technically operated and maintained by Arzonic ApS (CVR 45630102), acting as a data processor on behalf of Mjunker ApS. A data processing agreement has been established between the parties.

section5.title: 5. Disclaimer
section5.description: Mjunker ApS disclaims liability for any errors on the website and for consequences of downtime or service interruptions. Matters related to course registration and instruction are referred to Go’n Drive.

section6.title: 6. Changes
section6.description: We reserve the right to update these terms without prior notice. The latest version will always be available on the website.

section7.title: 7. Governing Law
section7.description: Use of this website is governed by Danish law. Any disputes will be handled according to applicable rules by the Danish courts.

q1.title: How long does it take?
q1.answer: It depends on the complexity of the project. A simple landing page can typically be ready in 1–2 weeks, while a custom web application or a 3D-enhanced solution may take 4–8 weeks or more. We always provide a realistic timeline at project start.

q2.title: Is maintenance included?
q2.answer: We offer both one-time solutions and ongoing maintenance. You can choose a support plan where we handle updates, security, and hosting – or we can hand it all over to you with full documentation.

q3.title: Can I edit content myself?
q3.answer: Yes! Most of our solutions include a user-friendly CMS or dashboard, allowing you to manage text, images, and content on your own. If preferred, we can also build static solutions with zero maintenance needs.

q4.title: What if I need new features later?
q4.answer: We build with scalability in mind. It's easy to add features or expand the solution later, and we're happy to help – whether it's bookings, integrations, e-commerce or something else.
